text: François Boucher (29 September 1703 in Paris - 30 May 1770) was a French painter, mostly known as one of the main artists of the French rococo movement. He painted several portraits of his patroness, Madame de Pompadour. He is also known for his open-minded voluptuous paintings. == Gallery of selected works == File:François Boucher 003.jpg|Self-portrait in the Studio, 1720, Louvre File:François Boucher - 'Putti with Birds'.jpg|Putti with Birds, c. 1730–1733, Honolulu Academy of Arts File:Boucher renaud et armide louvre.jpg|Renaud and Armide, 1734 File:Boucher dejeuner.jpg|The Breakfast 1739 File:Boucher Diane sortant du bain Louvre 2712.jpg|Diana Leaving the Bath 1742 File:François Boucher 015.jpg|L'Odalisque c. 1749, Louvre File:The Toilet of Venus, by François Boucher.jpg|The Toilet of Venus (1751) typifies the pleasing elegance of Boucher's mature style. File:Marie-Louise O'Murphy (1737-1818) painted by Francois Boucher (1703–1770).jpg|Marie-Louise O'Murphy c. 1752 File:Boucher Marquise de Pompadour 1756.jpg|Madame de Pompadour, 1756, Alte Pinakothek File:François Boucher - Les Forges de Vulcain (1757).JPG|Vulcan presenting Weapons for Aeneas to Venus, 1757 File:Saint Pierre tentant de marcher sur les eaux by François Boucher.jpg|Saint Peter Attempting to Walk on Water, 1766, Cathédrale Saint-Louis, Versailles File:Venus Consoling Love, François Boucher, 1751.jpg|Venus Consoling Love, 1751, National Gallery of Art in Washington, D.C. == Related pages == * List of French painters Category:French painters Category:1703 births Category:1770 deaths
title: François Boucher
